entry.dcterms:description: several standardized attitude scales (used in former surveys) were employed to longitudinally examine the temporal change of various aspects in authoritarianism (shortened F scale), social distance (Bogardus scale), anti-Roma and anti-Semitic sentiments, and the relationship between ethnic attitudes and political attitudes; main topics: anti-Semitism, anti-Roma feelings, xenophobia, authoritarinism, ethnic minorities, democratic rights, freedom of speech, political tolerance, political attitudes
